subject: Languages
title: Why Languages Never Stand Still
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Languages Never Stand Still.

hook.text: Every living language is changing right now â€” in pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar. None are exempt.

buildup.text: Old English is unreadable to modern English speakers. In 1,000 years, English transformed completely.

discovery.text: Language change is driven by how children learn, social pressures, and contact with other languages.

twist.text: People always think language is 'getting worse.' Every generation has said this for thousands of years.

climax.text: Language change isn't decay â€” it's evolution. Without it, we'd all still speak Proto-Indo-European.

punchline.text: A language that stops changing is a language that has died.
